content.description: Start matched on the under-cling pocket near the far left side of the overhung wall. Move up through small and sometimes sharp crimps to a deadpoint throw to a jug. Pop up to another jug at the lip. Keep your head together and do a heady, beta-intensive top out. Being short might actually help you on this part. You're not too high off the deck, but your brain might tell you otherwise.

Start on the under-cling rail on the right side of the 'gutter' in the middle of the wall. Throw out left for a good pinch rail and work out some core intensive beta to get to the obvious gaston pinch near the top-out. Go up and over with some insecure moves.

Start on the interesting tufa like block pinch nearing the center of the 'gutter'. Move left into the corner using crimps and spicy pocket dishes. Once you hit the jug it's not over, a techy top-out on more small dishes will demand your attention. A knee-bar pad helps unless you like the pain.

A huge cluster of rock with a hard overhung side and a more moderate side with some cool looking featured rock. Most, if not all of the lines on this boulder are going to be off the deck and although the landings are flat, they slope away from the wall. Topping out will take some head-game and heavy padding. When all the projects are finished this will definitely be one of the hardest walls in Tucson. Walk off is the stack of boulders near the right side of the 45 wall, you have to go down a little gutter and then hop off.
